data.name: Find The Parity Outlier redux
data.description:
Given an array of 3 or more integers, where all but one integer are either even or odd, return the integer that is not like the others.

For example:  
  - `findOutlier([2, 4, 0, 100, 4, 11, 2602, 36])`  
    Should return: `11`

While:  
  - `findOutlier([160, 3, 1719, 19, 11, 13, -21])`  
    Should return: `160`

If you get an error, like:  
```
The server timed out waiting for the code to finish executing. 
It is possible that this is due to high server load. It may also 
be caused by inefficent code. Please try your request again.
```  
_OR_  
```
Process was terminated. It took longer than 12000ms to complete
```  

_Then you need to find a more efficient algorithm!_ 
  
  
---
  
  
This specific kata is based largely on [obnounce](https://www.codewars.com/users/obnounce)'s "[Find The Parity Outlier](https://www.codewars.com/kata/find-the-parity-outlier/)", but requires at least a little bit of optimization.

Thanks to [yumaikas](https://www.codewars.com/users/yumaikas)' "[Multiples of 3 and 5 redux](https://www.codewars.com/kata/multiples-of-3-and-5-redux)" for the performance inspiration!

Thanks to [Benjamin Kästner](https://www.codewars.com/users/bkaes) for "[The conjured Codewars codex](http://bkaestner.github.io/codewars-rules/#always-test-all-corner-cases-of-your-input-domain)".   (I'm really just getting started, so I'm sure I missed stuff.)
